_accidents.CI_OtherType: Valve checkoff list for valve stations

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Sysco Louisville Inc.

7705 National Turnpike, Louisville, KY. 40214

Parent Company: SYSCO Corporation

Submission Receipt Date: 10-09-2012 

 

RMP Executive Summary below:

 

Sysco Louisville Inc., Risk Management Plan Executive Summary



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:



We at Sysco Louisville Inc. are committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as the design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration system at our facility.  It is our policy to implement appropriate control measures to prevent possible releases of Ammonia (anhydrous).  Unforeseeable, if such a release does occur; our highly trained employees are on hand to control and mitigate the effects of the release.  We are also completely coordinated with the Fairdale Fire Department, who provides our off-site emergency response services.



The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled:



We have one regulated substance present at our facility.  That substance is Ammonia (anhydrous).  The maximum inventory of Ammonia (anhydrous) that is expected to be present in this facility, based on process/operational requirements, is 11,000 pounds.



The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:



Our facility has taken the following steps as required by 40 CFR Part 68 of the Clean Air Act.  Our Ammonia (anhydrous) process is subject to the OSHA PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119.  Our facility is also subject to EPCRA Section 302 reporting requirements.  The following sections briefly describe the elements of the accidental release prevention program that is in place at our facility.





5-Year Accident History:



We have had one accidental release of Ammonia (anhydrous) at this facility during the past 5 years; t

he release was 12 pounds. No one offsite was injured, we evacuated the warehouse during the April 2010 release.



Emergency Response Plan:



Sysco Louisville Inc. are included in the written community emergency response plan.  The facility also has an emergency response plan.  The emergency response plan includes specific actions to be taken in response to an accidental release of Ammonia (anhydrous) and includes procedures for informing the public and local emergency response agencies in the event of an accidental release of Ammonia (anhydrous).  The emergency response plan also includes information on emergency health care.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:



Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program.  We will continue our annual facility emergency notification, evacuation and accountability training and drills.  All visitors, vendors, contractors and employees sign or check in and out of our facility.  In addition, they all receive emergency notification, evacuation and accountability training, or are the responsibility of another Sysco employee when they enter the facility.
